name: Calendar

unions.name: Config
unions.comment: An opaque type that holds the configuration for rendering the calendar.

unions.name: Scope
unions.comment: Used to describe the "zoom" level of the date data being rendered.

values.name: calendarMonthBounds
values.comment:
Get the first and last day of the calendar month that the given date is in.
E.g. in April 2024 the 1st is on a Monday and the 30th is on a Tuesday. If the
first day of the week is Sunday then the start date will be 2024-03-31 and the
end date will be 2024-05-04.

    import Date
    import Time

    Calendar.calendarMonthBounds Time.Sun (Date.fromCalendarDate 2024 Time.Apr 1)
    --> ( Date.fromCalendarDate  2024 Time.Mar 31, Date.fromCalendarDate  2024 Time.May 4 )

values.name: new
values.comment:
Start building up a new calendar. The `period` tells us
what year, month, and day we are looking at. The `scope` tells
us which "zoom" level to render the data at.

    Calendar.new
        { period = Date.fromCalendarDate 2024 Time.Feb 22
        , scope = Calendar.Month
        }
        |> Calendar.view
values.type: { period : Date.Date, scope : Calendar.Scope } -> Calendar.Config msg

values.name: toRowAndColumn
values.comment:
Get the row and column of the given date in a calendar month view.
Useful for placing content in the calendar grid.

    import Date
    import Time

    Calendar.toRowAndColumn Time.Sun (Date.fromCalendarDate 2024 Time.Apr 15)
    --> { row = 4, column = 2 }
values.type: Time.Weekday -> Date.Date -> { column : Basics.Int, row : Basics.Int }

values.name: view
values.comment:
Renders your `Config` to `Html`.
If you want to customize the rendering,use one of the various `withView...` functions.

    Calendar.new
        { period = Date.fromCalendarDate 2024 Time.Feb 22
        , scope = Calendar.Month
        }
        |> Calendar.view

values.name: weekBounds
values.comment:
Get the first and last day of the week that the given date is in,
relative to the start day of the week.

    import Date
    import Time

    Calendar.weekBounds Time.Sun (Date.fromCalendarDate 2024 Time.Apr 1)
    --> (Date.fromCalendarDate 2024 Time.Mar 31, Date.fromCalendarDate 2024 Time.Apr 6)

values.name: with24HourTime
values.comment:
Instead of AM & PM display times in 24-hour format.

    Calendar.new
        { period = Date.fromCalendarDate 2022 Time.Feb 22
        , scope = Calendar.Month
        }
        |> Calendar.with24HourTime
        |> Calendar.view

values.name: withViewDayHeader
values.comment:
Override the default rendering of the day header, for the `Day` scope.

    Calendar.new
        { period = Date.fromCalendarDate 2024 Time.Feb 22
        , scope = Calendar.Month
        }
        |> Calendar.withViewDayHeader
            (\weekday ->
                Html.text <|
                    case weekday of
                        Time.Mon ->
                            "Monday"

                        Time.Tue ->
                            "Tuesday"

                        Time.Wed ->
                            "Wednesday"

                        Time.Thu ->
                            "Thursday"

                        Time.Fri ->
                            "Friday"

                        Time.Sat ->
                            "Saturday"

                        Time.Sun ->
                            "Sunday"
            )
        |> Calendar.view
values.type: (Time.Weekday -> Html.Html msg) -> Calendar.Config msg -> Calendar.Config msg

values.name: withViewDayOfMonth
values.comment:
Override the default rendering of the day of the month, for the `Month` scope.

    Calendar.new
        { period = Date.fromCalendarDate 2024 Time.Feb 22
        , scope = Calendar.Month
        }
        |> Calendar.withViewDayOfMonth
            (\date ->
                Html.text
                    (String.fromInt (Date.day date))
            )
        |> Calendar.view
values.type: ({ column : Basics.Int, row : Basics.Int } -> Date.Date -> Html.Html msg) -> Calendar.Config msg -> Calendar.Config msg

values.name: withViewDayOfMonthOfYear
values.comment:
Override the default rendering of the day of the month, for the `Year` scope.

    Calendar.new
        { period = Date.fromCalendarDate 2024 Time.Feb 22
        , scope = Calendar.Month
        }
        |> Calendar.withViewDayOfMonthOfYear
            (\month date ->
                Html.text
                    (String.fromInt (Date.day date))
            )
        |> Calendar.view
values.type: (Time.Month -> Date.Date -> Html.Html msg) -> Calendar.Config msg -> Calendar.Config msg

values.name: withViewDayOfWeekHeader
values.comment:
Override the default rendering of the day header, for the `Week` scope.

    Calendar.new
        { period = Date.fromCalendarDate 2024 Time.Feb 22
        , scope = Calendar.Month
        }
        |> Calendar.withViewDayOfWeekHeader
            (\date ->
                date
                    |> Date.day
                    |> String.fromInt
                    |> Html.text
            )
        |> Calendar.view
values.type: (Date.Date -> Html.Html msg) -> Calendar.Config msg -> Calendar.Config msg

values.name: withViewMonthHeader
values.comment:
Override the default rendering of the month header, for the `Year` scope.

    Calendar.new
        { period = Date.fromCalendarDate  2024 Time.Feb 22
        , scope = Calendar.Month
        }
        |> Calendar.withViewMonthHeader
            (\month ->
                case month of
                    Time.Jan ->
                        Html.text "Jan"

                    Time.Feb ->
                        Html.text "Feb"

                    ...
            )
        |> Calendar.view
values.type: (Time.Month -> Html.Html msg) -> Calendar.Config msg -> Calendar.Config msg

values.name: withViewMultiDayEvent
values.comment:
Allows for placing things like multi-day events on the calendar,
spaning across multiple grid cells.

    Calendar.new
        { period = Date.fromCalendarDate 2024 Time.Feb 22
        , scope = Calendar.Month
        }
        |> Calendar.withViewMultiDayEvent
            [-- Your custom event rendering here
            ]
        |> Calendar.view
values.type: List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Calendar.Config msg -> Calendar.Config msg

values.name: withViewWeekdayHeader
values.comment:
Override the default rendering of the weekday header of the month.

    Calendar.new
        { period = Date.fromCalendarDate 2024 Time.Feb 22
        , scope = Calendar.Month
        }
        |> Calendar.withViewWeekdayHeader
            (\weekday ->
                Html.text <|
                    case weekday of
                        Time.Mon ->
                            "M"

                        Time.Tue ->
                            "T"

                        Time.Wed ->
                            "W"

                        Time.Thu ->
                            "T"

                        Time.Fri ->
                            "F"

                        Time.Sat ->
                            "S"

                        Time.Sun ->
                            "S"
            )
        |> Calendar.view
values.type: (Basics.Int -> Time.Weekday -> Html.Html msg) -> Calendar.Config msg -> Calendar.Config msg

values.name: withWeekStartsOn
values.comment:
By default this the week starts on Monday.
Use this function to change it to another day.

    Calendar.new
        { period = Date.fromCalendarDate 2022 Time.Feb 22
        , scope = Calendar.Month
        }
        |> Calendar.withWeekStartsOn Time.Sun
        |> Calendar.view
